title: Technical Sales Manager, Indonesia
company_description: As a premier global high-performance silicones and specialties company, Momentive creates solutions that improve quality of life for people and enable a more sustainable future. Our products are the result of a tireless pursuit of progress where the sun never sets on our global marketing and R&D efforts, resulting in innovations that help propel our customers’ businesses forward and positively impact all aspects of life – today, tomorrow, and into the future.
about_the_job:
Job Title

Technical Sales Manager, Indonesia

Summary

Full spectrum of Slab Sales and Technical accountability in Indonesia
Utilize current/potential resource to achieve sales and new production initiation target given by regional business manager.
Technical and commercial service which include troubleshooting for customers

Responsibilities Include

Sales/Customer (and distributors) Management.
Manage multiple distributors. Maintain a right balance between customer and company requirements to achieve our win/win objectives.
Business Development:

▪ Work closely with the Marketing/Technical team to identify growth opportunities, market segments and new applications.

▪ Focus on the end users level to support distributors for growth.

▪ Introduction of new products launches which include technical service

Global Key Account Management:

▪ Work with the global/regional key account Managers to implement key account strategy .

▪ Up-to-date developments of new technology, applications, support and retain global key account.

Technical Training and Development for distributors:
Market Intelligence:

▪ Provide timely and accurate information about the market and related downstream industries, competition and its activities.

▪ Raise problems with possible solutions/line of actions to counter these problems/issue.

Qualifications

The following are required for the role

Bachelor degree in Science or Technology
Good command of English communication
5-10 years experienced in Sales or Technical of Chemical Industry.
Experienced Sale or Technical in Polyurethane Flexible Foam Industry. Understand the Flexible foam related to furniture/bedding/automotive industries market are preferred.
Winning mentality
High Integrity, honest and transparent.
Strong believer in winning, quick learner, open mind and able to work under pressure.
Independent with excellent time management.
Passionate with strong desire and drive to succeed as to achieve yearly target.\

What We Offer

At Momentive, we value your well-being and offer competitive total rewards and development programs. Our inclusive culture fosters a strong sense of belonging and provides diverse career opportunities to help you unleash your full potential. Together, through innovative problem-solving and collaboration, we strive to create sustainable solutions that make a meaningful impact. Join our Momentive team to open a bright future. #BePartoftheSolution

About Us

Momentive is a premier global advanced materials company with a cutting-edge focus on silicones and specialty products. We deliver solutions designed to help propel our customer’s products forward—products that have a profound impact on all aspects of life, around the clock and from living rooms to outer space. With every innovation, Momentive creates a more sustainable future. Our vast product portfolio is made up of advanced silicones and specialty solutions that play an essential role in driving performance across a multitude of industries, including agriculture, automotive, aerospace, electronics, energy, healthcare, personal care, consumer products, building and construction, and more.

Momentive believes a diverse workforce empowers our people, strengthens our business, and contributes to a sustainable world. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any characteristic protected by law.

To be considered for this position candidates are required to submit an application for employment and be of legal working age as defined by local law. An offer may be conditioned upon the successful completion of pre-employment conditions, as applicable, and subject to applicable laws and regulations.

Note to third parties: Momentive is not seeking or accepting any unsolicited assistance from search and selection firms or employment agencies at this time.

company_description:

Samsung is also leading in the Internet of Things space through, among others, our Smart Home and Digital Health initiatives.

To discover more, please visit our website at www.samsung.com and our official newsroom at news.samsung.com
about_the_job:
Samsung Electronics Indonesia | North Cikarang, Bekasi - West Java |
Offline Test & Interview | Full Time | Contract Employment
(Disability Open to Apply)

Job Description:

Responsible for create or develop security systems/SOP
Responding to user support for system troubleshooting issues.
Maintenance existing data regarding security data.
Make an regularly improvement to upgrade security system.

Requirements:
Intermediate - Advance in English (written & speaking)
Bachelor Degree preferred Informatics with min. GPA 3.00
Had min 1 year experience in IT Infra (Fresh Graduate are welcome)
Excellent database, networking & computer literacy
Have good knowledge of Basic IT Security, IP & network config.
Perform strong background of data analytical & problem solving skills
Preferable hold any related IT certificate

Recruitment Scam Warning!!
Recently there have been a number of recruitment scams being carried out in various parts of the world. In this scam some people contact job seekers claiming to represent Samsung Electronics Indonesia, offer them jobs and then ask for payment for various expenses and administrative costs.

Samsung Electronics Indonesia will never charge you at any stage in the recruitment process.

This is a longstanding scam used by criminal groups. This scam has affected job seekers looking for work from many reputable companies and organizations.

In order to prevent from recruitment scams:
1. Don't respond to unsolicited offers from people you don't know
2. Don't disclose personal or financial information to anyone you don't know
3. Check for grammatical or spelling errors in the document as these are often a warning sign of fraud
4. Beware of employers or agents using webmail email addresses such as @Yahoo @Hotmail or other free webmail domains
5. If you are asked for anything from a recruiter on behalf of us, please contact the local police as this is most likely a scam.

Interview Participants
Maintain the security and confidentiality of all company information known to the current/previous company in the form of data, product information and specifications, pricing policies, customer lists, operating procedures, processes, financial information, legal information, formulas, methodologies, but not limited to matters mentioned above.

title: MANAGER TRAINING – TECHNICAL OPERATIONS & HSE
company_description: PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (IDX: AMMN) is the largest copper and gold producer listed on the Indonesian Stock Exchange. Through its subsidiary PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara (AMNT), the company owns and operates the Batu Hijau mine, Indonesia’s second-largest copper-gold mine. AMNT is also processing ore into copper concentrate, as well as exploration activities at the Elang project. Through PT Amman Mineral Industri (AMIN), a smelter and a precious-metal refinery are also being built and targeted to be operational in 2024. Upon completion of the copper smelter and PMR facilities, AMMAN will become a fully integrated mining-to-smelting business. We are committed to leading with sustainable practices and creating a legacy of the best for Indonesia and the world.
about_the_job:
Some of your duties will include:

To Maintain organization’s Training by planning, implementing, and evaluating training policies, programs, and practice to enhance Training and Development services.
To conduct the tracking and reporting of the progress for all on-going training services to ensure all training program is running well.
To originates and leads training practices and objectives to ensure the alignment with company objectives.
To manage company objectives and all applicable Government of Indonesia regulatory and permit obligation for Training and Mine Operation HSE with reporting, compliance, and other statutory requirements.
To be accountable for the execution of plans/projects in each of these functions and responsible for the training and development of employees in SHLP Department.
Oversees the implementation of Training and Development Plan and Operational Mine HSE.
Oversees and manages the work of reporting Training and Mine Ops HSE staff. Encourages the ongoing development of Training and Mine Operation HSE staff.
Develops and monitors an annual budget that includes Training and Mine Operation HSE.
Conducts a continuing study of all Training and Mine Operation policies, programs, and practices to keep management informed of new developments.
Prepares periodic reports for management, as necessary or requested, to track strategic goal accomplishment.
Provides advices and counsel to superintendent, supervisors, and employees as to Training and Development policies and procedures and Mine Operation HSE policies and procedures.
Participates in management, and company staff meetings and attends other meetings and seminars.
Develop and ensures that new procedure(s) as complied with, both Departmental and holding corporate, and ensures compliance with company standard operating procedures.
Implements Emergency Response Plan Procedure(s) as complied with, both Departmental and holding corporate, and ensure compliances with company standard operating procedures.
Conduct annual side wide risk register (IBPR) for Mining Department and follow up priority as appropriate.
Manage Mining Department Risk Register and evaluation of the implementation layer audit for Top 10 High Risk to each department involvement.
Responsible to the preparation and submittal for accident/incident report in mining site area to Senior Manager SHE.

What skills and experience do you need?

Bachelor’s degree in Business or Engineering in Mining/ Civil/ Mechanical/ Process/ Geology/ Industrial Engineering. Master’s degree is a plus;
20+ years of Technical and HSE Training Operations experience in a complexed mining industry/company, with 10 years of experience as Manager/Superintendent Technical Training focused Managed Human Resources or Technical Operations Training and Development or Mine Operational HSE Training;
Proven track record complying with the Statutory Mining and HSEQ requirements.
Strong understanding in setting tasks, resources and schedules to meet work plan;
Good knowledge of recruitment, coaching, mentoring and the development an established training team;
Proven experience work across multi discipline business while listening and delivering to the various Department needs;
Strong driving key systematic processes which track, report and measure competency compliance by Department (and proactively address these gaps);
Experience Implement alternative ways to connect with training participants to ensure knowledge retention and understanding of key concepts;
Proven experience establish robust Trainee and Graduate programs to grow our Safety and Production performance;
Large scale Mine based experience is preferred, however like scale / complexity / multidiscipline experience is preferred (Mineral processing, Petrochemical, Power Generation, Heavy Industrial, Civil Construction etc.)
 Excellent engagement skills to be utilized across a variety of key stakeholder (Government (supporting GovRel), Community (supporting SR), and various Dept. Leaders)
 Good knowledge in Competency based Training and Preferably have a proven record of good working relationships with governmental agencies with responsibilities for Safety and Health
Has good knowledge and practice in Mining, Construction, Indonesia Regulation in DEMR (Kepmen 18016/2018, Kepmen 1827/2018, Kepdirjen 185/2019); Good knowledge and demonstrate Accident Incident Investigation Loss Caution Models, Contractor Safety Management System, SMKP Implementation in the organization refer to Kepdirjen 185/2019, Implementation OHSAS 18001: 2007, Implementation OHSAS ISO 45001: 2018, Accident/Incident Investigation ICAMS, Internal Audit ISO14001.
Has Certified IV in Training or similar, Certificate as Auditor for OHSAS 18001: 2007, Certificate as Auditor ISO 45001:2018
Have middle level operational inspector certificate (POM) and (POU) level of DEMR Certification.
Develop business plans/objectives/targets for the Technical Training and Mine Operational HSE Training that are aligned with Corporate and Site business requirements.
Experience in developing and implementing Technical and HSE Operations Training strategies and policies that align with business objectives; Has ability to propose new initiative procedure to ensure effective and efficient Technical Operations Training and Mine Operational HSE Training aspect within Operational Site; Demonstrate as champion business improvement and optimization activities to achieve operational efficiencies.
Experience managing People Development; Experience managing budgets and expenses related to HR functions; Comply with Business Plan annual budget timely manner for Training and Mine Operational HSE.
Has proficiency skill to do Benchmarking with other Indonesia Mining Company within aspect of Technical Training and Mine Operational HSE.
Strong leadership and management skills, including the ability to lead and develop a team of Training professionals; Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to use data to make informed decisions; Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment; Strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills.
Excellent communication skills in English both verbal and written and computer literate.

Please be aware of certain frauds or misinformation regarding recruitment advertising on behalf of AMMAN We never ask for any payments whatsoever from applicants or candidates during the recruitment process. We never ask applicants or candidates to use specific travel agent services to make arrangements for transportation and accommodation during the recruitment process.

title: Controls Lead Engineer
company_description:
Baker Hughes (NASDAQ: BKR) is an energy technology company that provides solutions for energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

For more than a century, our inventions have revolutionized energy. We harness the power of engineering, data, and science to redefine what's possible. Our diverse portfolio of equipment and service capabilities span the energy and industrial value chain. Our two operating segments, Oilfield Services & Equipment (OFSE) and Industrial & Energy Technology (IET), are organized based on the nature of our markets and customers, and consist of similar products and services. Visit us at bakerhughes.com to learn more.
about_the_job:
Lead Subsea Controls Engineer

Do you like working in collaborative teams and solving technical problems?

Are you a subsea engineering expert looking for a new opportunity?

Join our Team!

Baker Hughes has developed a comprehensive portfolio of systems and products to deliver optimal subsea solutions. That means we consistently deliver solutions that will meet or exceed even your most demanding requirements.

Partner with the best

The Lead Subsea Controls Engineer will be responsible for providing technical expertise, leadership and governance to a range of activities related to the Baker Hughes Control System install base within the Services APACI Region

As a Lead Subsea Controls Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Leading all applicable Health, Safety, Environmental, and Quality requirements
Developing and executing scopes in line with customer and project requirements and priorities
Defining Cost Time Resource (CTR) requirements for engineering planning and forecasting purposes
Driving engineering and team activities globally to ensure “on time” delivery to the customer to the project schedule proactively.
Overseeing for documentation delivery
Managing customer point of contact for all project engineering aspects


Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:


Have Bachelors in Instrumentation and Control Systems Engineering, or Industrial Computer Systems Engineering or related discipline.
Have +10 years of engineering experience within the subsea industry or related service organisation.
Show proactive and results oriented, self-motivated and ability to work independently and in a team.
Have field experience in subsea installations, troubleshooting and interventions
Have sound knowledge of environmental, health and safety, and quality regulations within the oil and gas industry.
Have good communication skills, with an ability to communicate well in a multi-lingual/multi-cultural team environment
Have domain expertise in subsea control systems


Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:


Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit in everything in and work when you are the most productive


Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:


Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Comprehensive private medical care options
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits


About Us:

We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Join Us:

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Customer Support Team Lead - ID
company_description:
Cargill is a family company committed to providing food, ingredients, agricultural solutions, and industrial products to nourish the world in a safe, responsible, and sustainable way. We sit at the heart of the supply chain, partnering with producers and customers to source, make and deliver products that are vital for living.  

We provide customers with life’s essentials to enable businesses to grow, communities to prosper and consumers to live well in their daily lives.  With sustainability embedded in our purpose, it’s part of everything we do. 

We listen and we care, so we can anticipate and meet our customers’ needs in an ever-changing world. Ours is a long-term view, harnessing over 158 years of experience to look ahead while remaining true to the values that have guided us from the start. We put people first. We reach higher. We do the right thing—today and for generations to come.  
…
show more
about_the_job:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 157 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.

Job Purpose and Impact

The Customer Support Team Lead – ID will play an essential role in the customer service organization and lead a team of talented individuals to execute data processing, data management and data protection related activities across multiple platforms for SEA countries. The Customer Support Team Lead will lead a team to embrace a Customer 1st mindset to execute the processing of complex contracts, orders from customers, generating accurate customer invoices and shipment documentation for products coming in and moving out of SEA region.

Key Accountabilities

Manage a team of customer support specialists across SEA regional locations in Cargill on the accuracy and consistency of complex customer and contracts, orders, invoices and shipment documentation with differentiated service level agreements which follows our customer segmentation strategy, ensuring effective cross-functional collaboration across the customer experience and customer operation teams, as well as other teams that do not report directly to you – global trade compliance operations, finance and etc. 
Analyze and interpret reports and metrics and work closely with the cross-functional team to conduct root cause analysis and provide clarification to find resolutions and influence the team in accepting new ideas, approaches and concepts. 
Work with Customer Support Manager to lead the preparation and reporting of internal and external joint customer scorecards, developing sustainable controls to maintain data hygiene, implementing high levels of confidentiality and data security standards. 
Collaborate with customer experience insights and analytics team to provide direction on the resolution to turn customer issues of the highest complexity, feedback and pain points into meaningful solutions and outcomes. 
Investigate opportunities to drive change and continuous improvement throughout the customer support team by eliminating waste, streamlining and standardizing processes. 
Develop the team on the measurement of customer experience, process performance and order management tools and technologies. 
Coach, motivate & develop team and make decisions related to talent management, succession planning and engagement, hiring, performance management, and disciplinary actions, fostering a team that encourages learning, job scope evolving and a career progressing for our promising and talented customer support team members. 
Other duties as assigned. 

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Minimum of two years of Customer Service OR Data Processing leadership experience
Other minimum qualifications may apply. 

Preferred Qualifications

One year experience in leading an operations team, in a fast-paced environment. 
Knowledge of international trade regulations, export compliance and export documentation will be and added advantage. 
Self-disciplined, diligent, proactive and detail oriented impacting time management and organizational skills. 
Ability to coach a team to maintain high levels of confidentiality and data security standards, working under pressure to adhere to service level agreements. 
Conducting performance management, talent development, succession planning and engagement.

title: Technical Services Manager
company_description:
Our mission began more than 150 years ago in 1866 when Henry Sherwin and Edward Williams founded the company in Cleveland, Ohio. The duo went on to shape an industry and create a global legacy. That legacy continues on today as we look ahead and continue to innovate our future. With stores, distribution centers and facilities spanning the globe, we're able to deliver the best in paints, coatings and related products to the world. From our headquarters to our 130 distribution centers and more than 4,000 retail locations, we continue to grow in new and exciting ways.

Here, there's no one path to success. Our 60,000+ employees are diverse, innovative and passionate. Our employees worldwide bring their energy and unique perspectives to each new day. We believe in careers that grow with you and open up new opportunities. With the support of a global team, you can innovate, grow and discover a career where you can thrive and Create Your 𝗣𝗼𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗯𝗹𝗲™.

about_the_job:
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: 
· Provide technical and color support and services to importers, distributors and end-users.
· Provide training on the complete range of Sherwin-Williams products to importer, distributors and end users.
· Perform product demonstrations for existing and new business development
· Technical support other regions as required.
· Identify and pursue opportunities for business development. 
· Perform cold calls on new businesses or competitor accounts to introduce the Sherwin-Williams products and services.
· Partner with distributors and resellers to develop new account target lists.
· Maintain and update Salesforce CRM database.
· Establish and maintain effective working relationships with importers, distributors and end users.
· Perform technical cycle calls for existing accounts.
· Provide solutions for customers through technical analysis to resolve performance or technical issues.
· Gather market intel on competitor products and share with team.
· Participate in professional self-development to ensure technical skills remain relevant.
· Ensure all safety requirements are followed in any training facility or client site. 
___________________________________________________________________________
SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, necessary to build collaborative working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.
· Strong problem-solving skills, to resolve technical issues. 
· Excellent time management and prioritization with the ability to manage multiple priorities with competing deadlines.
Demonstrated experience in an automotive refinish sales environment.
Advanced knowledge and experience with CRM systems and processes (Salesforce).
Ability to influence and drive alignment among a diverse set of stakeholders.
Formal qualifications in Automotive Refinish.
English reading, writing and simply verbal communication skill is mandatory required.

title: IT Network Maintenance & System Support

Bank Sahabat Sampoerna is a Financial Services company located in Sampoerna Strategic Square, Karet Semanggi, Jakarta Raya, Indonesia.

As a Bank, we strive to provide high-quality banking services to the public in order to support, assist, and accompany them, especially our customers in the Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) sector,in financial decision making, so that they may achieve a greater state of wellbeing.
about_the_job:
Bank Sahabat Sampoerna is looking for IT Network Maintenance & System Support who will be responsible for the following:
Network Design and Planning to meet current and future needs.
Implementation and Deployment, installing and configuring network equipment, including routers, switches, firewalls, and other devices.
Network monitoring. Ensure network conditions are always good and analyze network traffic patterns.
Maintenance and troubleshooting. Perform routine maintenance tasks, identify root causes, and implement solutions.
Create network diagrams and documentation of changes, and procedures that are accurate and up to date.

For this position, we will need someone who:
Minimum Bachelor's degree
Have a CCNA certificate
Minimum 2 years experience as a Network Engineer in Banking
Strong understanding of Computer Network concepts, Computer Network Security
Have the ability to solve computer network problems
Have experience working in on-cloud and on-preme platforms
Have knowledge and experience related to IT Infrastructure, Disaster Recovery plans and configuration management

title: Associate Manager, Data Science
company_description:
IQVIA (NYSE:IQV) is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions, and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. IQVIA creates intelligent connections across all aspects of healthcare through its analytics, transformative technology, big data resources and extensive domain expertise. IQVIA Connected Intelligence™ delivers powerful insights with speed and agility — enabling customers to accelerate the clinical development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments that improve healthcare outcomes for patients. With approximately 86,000 employees, IQVIA conducts operations in more than 100 countries.

IQVIA is a global leader in protecting individual patient privacy. The company uses a wide variety of privacy-enhancing technologies and safeguards to protect individual privacy while generating and analyzing information on a scale that helps healthcare stakeholders identify disease patterns and correlate with the precise treatment path and therapy needed for better outcomes. IQVIA’s insights and execution capabilities help biotech, medical device and pharmaceutical companies, medical researchers, government agencies, payers and other healthcare stakeholders tap into a deeper understanding of diseases, human behaviors and scientific advances, in an effort to advance their path toward cures. To learn more, visit www.iqvia.com.
about_the_job:

Develop and manage deployment of Tech & Apps products.
In charge of communication with the internal stakeholders within IQVIA to any discussion related to Statistical Methodology, Quality Control Initiatives, and new Offering Development.
Provide technical support to clients when required.
Analyze the customer’s requirement and ensure that the outcomes are delivered on time, follows high quality standards and meets customer’s expectations
Researches, analyzes and responds to client inquiries that are routine in nature.

Qualifications

Bachelor Degree of Statistical / Data Science from Reputable University
Min 3 years of Experience as Data Science with deep knowledge of Indonesia Pharma Market
Strong Exposure in market research Agency is preferred

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com
